content:
I would like to have a "completed curation" label stay after publication.
https://guides.dataverse.org/en/latest/installation/config.html#allowedcurationlabels
According to this section in the guide, curation label is removed after publication.
I think it is important to know that curation has been done on a dataset and would like this label, or some sort of badge on a dataset to make this known.

Here are some older issues, which were just closed... well, I may be a day late - a dollar short.

Support measures of Data and Metadata Quality #6041

Support Open Badges
https://github.com/IQSS/dataverse/issues/2119

Would it be useful to make a new issue?
Sure, a new issue would be useful.
One thing about these labels is that they can be customized per installation.
So we'd probably need to add some way to indicate (in the database) which label is the one to show after publication.
Yes! Knowing that curation has been done is still very much needed at our installation too. A new issue would be very useful :grinning:
@Dimitri Szabo @Philip Durbin 🐉 Finally got around to adding this as an issue (Feature Request).
@Philip Durbin 🐉 Sorry.... didn't mean to play "Hide-N-seak" on the new issue.
Sherry Lake has marked this topic as resolved.
